title: 104_hr1140
content: The Act titled "Tuberculosis Prevention and Control Amendments of 1995" is cited as the short title. It includes programs of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. The Act "Tuberculosis Prevention and Control Amendments of 1995" amends Section 317E of the Public Health Service Act to increase funding for prevention, control, and elimination services. This includes raising the budget to $385,000,000 for fiscal year 1995, $85,000,000 for emergency grants, and providing necessary funds for fiscal years 1997 through 2000. The Act "Tuberculosis Prevention and Control Amendments of 1995" authorizes $80,000,000 for grants for tuberculosis prevention, control, and elimination for fiscal year 1996, with additional funding for fiscal years 1997 through 2000. The funds will be administered by the Secretary of Health and Human Services through the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. The program of grants allows for bulk purchases of medications and supplies for tuberculosis. Grants can also be used for services related to incarceration. Research, demonstration projects, education, and training funding amounts are specified for fiscal years 1994 through 2000. Training centers for health professionals are also included in the provisions. The Secretary of Health and Human Services may make grants for the establishment of up to 5 training centers to train health professionals in the prevention and control of tuberculosis, including identifying multi-drug resistant forms of the disease. Grant funds can be used for screenings, treatment, and referrals for tuberculosis services. The Secretary may authorize grants for up to 5 training centers to train health professionals in tuberculosis prevention and control, including multi-drug resistant forms. Grant funds can be used for facilities, equipment, and laboratories to provide sophisticated training. Applications for grants must be submitted to the Secretary. The Secretary may authorize grants for training centers to train health professionals in tuberculosis prevention and control. Grants are limited to $5,000,000 per year for up to 3 years, subject to annual approval and availability of funds. The Secretary is responsible for evaluations and dissemination of information. The Secretary may provide evaluations and disseminate information from centers for tuberculosis prevention and control. $25,000,000 is authorized for fiscal year 1996, with additional funding for subsequent years. SEC. 3. RESEARCH THROUGH NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES. Technical Correction: Subpart 6 of title IV of the Public Health Service Act is amended by transferring and redesignating section 447 as 447A. Section 447A is further amended to allocate specific funding for fiscal years 1995 through 2000. SEC. 4. CONSTRUCTION OR MODERNIZATION OF HEALTH FACILITIES. Section 1610 of the Public Health Service Act is amended to allow the Secretary to make grants for projects related to tuberculosis prevention, control, and elimination. This includes funding for construction, modernization, and renovation of medical facilities for underserved populations, as well as facilities for long-term care and incarceration. Grants may cover up to 80% of the project costs. The Secretary can provide grants for projects related to tuberculosis prevention, control, and elimination, covering up to 80% of project costs. In urban or rural poverty areas, grants may cover up to 100% of costs. $100,000,000 is authorized for grants in 1995, $250,000,000 in 1996, and necessary sums for 1997-2000.
